context: In 2005, Bentley Systems was an established provider of infrastructure engineering software, founded in 1984. The company's flagship product MicroStation competed in the CAD market for civil engineering, architecture, and infrastructure projects. In 2005, Bentley was actively expanding through acquisitions, having acquired Rebis and Infrasoft in 2003, Haestad Methods in 2004, and completing the acquisition of Research Engineers International (REI) and its STAAD structural analysis product in August 2005. The company was also expanding into the telecom sector. The primary competition came from Autodesk's infrastructure and civil engineering products.
